overview_summary: All five neighbors have an undetermined stance, with none having made public statements for or against the development. Likewise, none are high-profile community figures; most keep low profiles as private landowners (one was a town historian in the past), so overall community influence is low.

neighbors.name: Leo N. Foland
neighbors.claims: Leo N. Foland owns land in Cobleskill but maintains a low community profile, with no mention of him in local news or civic records ([www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com](https://www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com/index.asp?type=Social#:~:text=Cobleskill%20Times,floats%2C%20followed%20by%20a%20short)). He has not participated visibly in development or energy debates, and no public statements by him were found ([www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com](https://www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com/article.asp?id=11531#:~:text=2007%3A%20A%20look%20back%20at,Mayor)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a personal, respectful one-on-one approach. Acknowledge his long local ties and quietly listen to any concerns he may have.

neighbors.name: Giovanni Capocci
neighbors.claims: Giovanni Capocci is a Cobleskill landowner (PIN 33.-3-10) with no record of civic engagement or public commentary in local sources ([www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com](https://www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com/archives.asp?date1=2018-7-01&date2=2018-7-25#:~:text=%2A%20Middleburgh%20teen%20publishes%20first,18%C2%A07%2F18%2F2018)). There are no indications of his stance on development or clean energy, as he hasn’t appeared in any reports or meetings on such issues ([www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com](https://www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com/index.asp?type=Social#:~:text=Cobleskill%20Times,floats%2C%20followed%20by%20a%20short)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Provide clear, direct information and invite his questions. Since he isn’t publicly active, a straightforward, factual outreach to address any personal concerns is advisable.

neighbors.name: Raymond D. Briggs
neighbors.claims: Raymond D. Briggs was born in 1924 on a family farm in Carlisle and was a lifelong Schoharie County resident ([www.merenessputnamfuneralhome.com](https://www.merenessputnamfuneralhome.com/obituaries/raymond-briggs#:~:text=Carlisle,area%20resident%20and%20received%20his)). He served as the Town of Carlisle’s historian and was active in local heritage circles, reflecting community involvement until his death in 2011 ([www.merenessputnamfuneralhome.com](https://www.merenessputnamfuneralhome.com/obituaries/raymond-briggs#:~:text=Carlisle%20Town%20Historian%20and%20was,Bernard%29%20Braun)) ([www.merenessputnamfuneralhome.com](https://www.merenessputnamfuneralhome.com/obituaries/raymond-briggs#:~:text=Carlisle,area%20resident%20and%20received%20his)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with his family (e.g., his local sons) when addressing this property. Showing respect for the family’s legacy and the historical significance of their land will help build goodwill.

neighbors.name: Daniel A. Santoro
neighbors.claims: Daniel A. Santoro has no notable public presence in Cobleskill’s civic affairs ([www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com](https://www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com/index.asp?type=Social#:~:text=Cobleskill%20Times,floats%2C%20followed%20by%20a%20short)). No public records or news reports show him taking any stand on local development or clean energy projects ([www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com](https://www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com/archives.asp?date1=2018-7-01&date2=2018-7-25#:~:text=%2A%20Middleburgh%20teen%20publishes%20first,18%C2%A07%2F18%2F2018)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out in an informal, neighborly way. Because he isn’t publicly active, a personal conversation to hear any concerns and build rapport is the best approach.

neighbors.name: David L. DeGeorge
neighbors.claims: David L. DeGeorge’s property appears to be a multi-generational farm; several DeGeorge family members (ages spanning late 30s to late 60s) reside there, with one listed as a farmer by occupation ([hudwayglass.com](https://hudwayglass.com/HIGHWAY%2BROUTE%2B20%2C%2BDorloo%2BNY#:~:text=David%20L%20Degeorge%20%20,Job%3A%20Craftsman%2FBlue%20Collar)). He has kept out of the spotlight regarding local developments, and no public remarks from him on such issues are documented ([www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com](https://www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com/index.asp?type=Social#:~:text=Cobleskill%20Times,floats%2C%20followed%20by%20a%20short)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage with the family’s primary farmer (e.g., Naphtali DeGeorge) directly on site. Emphasize how the project will protect their farmland and address any practical farming concerns to align with their long-term interests.
